title: Modified Rankin Score-9Q (mRS-9Q)
desc: The Modified Rankin Score-9Q (mRS-9Q) assesses level of function in neurological disease.

orgreference.text: Patel N, Rao VA, Heilman-Espinoza ER, Lai R, Quesada RA, Flint AC. Simple and reliable determination of the modified rankin scale score in neurosurgical and neurological patients: the mRS-9Q. Neurosurgery. 2012;71(5):971-975; discussion 975.

other_refer.text: Quinn TJ, Dawson J, Walters MR, Lees KR. Reliability of the modified Rankin Scale: a systematic review. Stroke. 2009;40(10):3393-3395.

data.evidence:
The mRS-9Q is conducted by asking the following yes/no questions:

  • Do you have any symptoms that are bothering you?

  • Are you able to do the same work as before?

  • Are you able to keep up with your hobbies?

  • Have you maintained your ties to friends and family?

  • Do you need help making a simple meal, doing household chores, or balancing a checkbook?

  • Do you need help with shopping or traveling close to home?

  • Do you need another person to help you walk?

  • Do you need help with eating, going to the toilet, or bathing?

  • Do you stay in bed most of the day and need constant nursing care?
data.facts:
Interpretation:

Question

Answer

mRS-9Q

Do you have any symptoms that are bothering you?

Yes

1

Are you able to do the same work as before?

OR

Are you able to keep up with your hobbies?

OR

Have you maintained your ties to friends and family?

No

2

Do you need help making a simple meal, doing household chores, or balancing a checkbook?

OR

Do you need help with shopping or traveling close to home?

 Yes

3

Do you need another person to help you walk?

OR

Do you need help with eating, going to the toilet, or bathing?

 Yes

4

Do you stay in bed most of the day and need constant nursing care?

 Yes

5

An mRS-9Q of 0 is given otherwise.

A higher mRS-9Q corresponds to higher severity of neurological disease.
